name: Carbone New York
address: 181 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Amazing shoutout to Dave for the table.
Service was amazing, Food was even better.. the beef cappaccio stole the show for me. My fiance love the place, we went for a brunch date.
Definitely the hot spot! Great atmosphere, great vibes and now my new go-to spot!!!! â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

Love the old school service. Baked clams, spicy vodka rigatoni, and linguine Congolese were delicious! Brunello wine + limoncello + chocolate hazelnut cake with crÃ¨me anglaise for dessert was the perfect ending.

The only service fault was that the waiter placed our clam order on another table, it sat on the other table for a bit, then he tried to serve it to us. We spoke to a manager who apologized and swiftly had the kitchen prepare a new clam dish. Happy with the resolution.

This Place is so hard to book a Reservation and if you do find a Table it's a 11pm Reservation Which i feel that's a little to later to Digest food and my kids shouldn't have to wait until 11pm to have Dinner
My fav carbone location â™¡ :)

A Wonderful Experience at Carbone

I had a truly pleasant experience dining at Carbone. The atmosphere was vibrant yet elegant, and the service was warm and attentive from start to finish. Every dish was flavorful and beautifully presented â€” especially the pasta, which was cooked to perfection. It felt like the kind of meal you savor and remember. Definitely a place Iâ€™d recommend for a special night out or to celebrate something meaningful.

5 stars across the board. This establishment never fails. I have eaten at the location in Vegas and now here in New York. Spicy rigatoni is to die for. Tonight they had a burrata with caviar which was by far the best burrata I have ever had in my life. This restaurant is a must eat at no doubt about it. The atmosphere is as authentic as you could ever dream. Thank you Carbone for such a perfect meal.
Ottima qualitÃ  e ottimo servizio!
Who doesnâ€™t love authentic Italian pasta. Recommended and approved.

Carbone is one of New Yorkâ€™s most iconic restaurants â€” and for good reason. Yes, reservations can be tough to get (youâ€™ll need to book about 30 days in advance), but trust me, itâ€™s absolutely worth it. Dining here is more than just a meal â€” itâ€™s an experience. The atmosphere is timeless, elevated, and makes you feel genuinely special whether youâ€™re there for lunch or dinner.

My go-to cocktail is the Whiskey Smash, crafted with a quality Scotch â€” perfectly balanced and refreshing (thank me later!). As for the food, you truly canâ€™t go wrong with anything on the menu. The Spicy Rigatoni Vodka and Tortellini al RagÃ¹ are must-tries, and Marioâ€™s Meatballs are an instant favorite. To finish, the Lemon Cheesecake is the perfect way to end the night â€” light, rich, and full of flavor.

Carbone never disappoints â€” itâ€™s the kind of place that reminds you why New York dining is world-class. A true culinary experience from start to finish.

TL;DR: Worth the hype. Great service, standout red sauce dishes, and a classic NYC atmosphere. Book early and try a late lunch for a relaxed experience.

Carbone lived up to its reputation. We were visiting from LA and didnâ€™t know what to expect, but from the moment we walked in the staff made us feel welcome. The energy is old school but fun. Our server was easily one of the best parts of the night, he was attentive, charismatic, and clearly proud of what he does. That kind of service makes a big difference.

The red sauce pastas are the star here, but everything we tried had great flavor. The Caesar was sharp and balanced, and the cocktails were spot on. We came for a late lunch, which was perfect since dinner gets packed. The whole meal felt smooth, unhurried, and well worth planning ahead for.

If you can get a reservation, do it. The food, service, and atmosphere all line up exactly the way you hope they will
Everybody is friendly and the food is super good.
Took forever to get a reservation. Food was very expensive and very okay.
First time at Carbone and it was incredible! The food, drinks, and service were all top-notch. The spicy rigatoni and lemon cheesecake were perfection. Canâ€™t wait to go back!
Always perfect

As a first timer at Carbone this past Friday night I truly have to say that the service, food, drinks, and atmosphere were impeccable! A HUGE thank you to the manager Alfonso, bartender Chi Chi, and our servers Marco & Carlos. Amaretto Sour is my go-to drink and Chi Chi made the best one Iâ€™ve ever tasted yet! We ordered the Caesar salad, spicy rigatoni, lobster ravioli, the meatballs, and lemon cheesecake. They were all prepared and cooked to perfection! The staff definitely made the experience for my boyfriend Alfonso & I memorable. I appreciate all the hospitality and love theyprovided throughout the night. Their service went above and beyond and exceeded all my expectations. They treated my boyfriend and I like family. This was a perfect 11pm late dinner spot. Cant wait to be back and experience this all over again - I already have another reservation booked next month!

When a lunch reservation slot unexpectedly opened, we were delighted to enjoy Italian food as it is meant to be. Our trifecta? Rigatoni, tortellini, and meatballs. Their garlic bread trio appetizer and Caesar salad were also delicious and nearly entree serving size. Top that off with Italian flag colored cookies and youâ€™ll say: â€œil magiare era eccellente!â€

Visited Carbone NYC for a work lunch and had an excellent experience. The service was exceptional, and the Italian dishes were flavorful and beautifully presented. Highlights included the light and airy Carbone meatball (never thought Iâ€™d describe a meatball light & airy!), rigatoni, and lobster ravioli; all perfectly cooked and full of flavor. Since I was with a larger group, I really appreciated the thoughtful service of pre-splitting the rigatoni and serving it individually on our own plates.

The cozy, intimate Greenwich Village restaurant has that classic New York charm and the menus are hilariously oversized for such a tiny space. You practically need your own table just to open one!
Good meal but not worth the hype
The Spicy Rig and Veal Parm. The best. The tiramisu was also really good.
Worth the hype, great service and food. Went for lunch I would imagine dinner would be a better experience.
Very nice. Food was fabulous.  Enjoyed our meal very much. Service was phenomenal. Highly recommend Carbone.
Decent
Bad experience, poor service, overpriced, bad atmosphere - waste of money!

Absolutely excellent, authentically Italian food! Every part of the experience, from the ambiance to the service to the food itself, was incredible. I loved the kitchenâ€™s attention to detail and commitment to quality. Truly a memorable dining experience for anyone who appreciates Italian cuisine.

If you like rigatoni and general hospitality. Mixed in with water down meat balls and a place soldly relying on  image and mystique from 20 years ago. Then you have found yourself exactly where you can spend over $150.00 on the above food and lack  of ambiance. .Believe when I say you can definitely find better food elsewhere and better hospitality.
One of the best restaurants in New York City.  Everything was on point, excellent all over. Super clean and everyone made you feel very special.
You need Reservation

Iâ€™ve been to Carbone in Miami, but had to make my way to the OG in NYC and not gonna lie, the food here is on another level. Everything just hit better at this location.

The spicy rigatoni, clams, Caesar salad, bread basket, desserts, and the meatballs were all outstanding and absolutely worth it.

That said, I wouldnâ€™t recommend the ribeye it was underwhelming and lacked flavor compared to everything else. Stick to the classics, because thatâ€™s where Carbone NYC really shines.

Meatballs 3 super large, chewy, pure tomato sauce  w/o much seasoning, slightly sour
Assorted Baked Clams 4 three flavors, pesto, uni, spicy w/ bacon, flavorful
Lobster Ravioli 5 Chinese dumpling shaped, large minced filling, lobster chunks, flavorful white cheesy sauce
Spicy Rigatoni Vodka 3 hard, chewy, not a lot of sauce, flavorful, mild spicy
A fantastic meal from start to finish. Worth every penny. Thank you to the waitstaff impeccable service.

I really, Really, REALLY wanted to be unimpressed by Carbone. If you've ever tried to get a reservation there, you know why. To say it is difficult is an understatement. However, I was able to snag a reservation on my birthday, which was perfect because my wife was really looking forward to it. I warned her in advance: don't get your hopes up...we've been to several 3 Star Michelin restaurants and hype-y places tend to be overrated. That was my wishful thinking and goodness, was I wrong.

First, the atmosphere. Close but not cramped. Well-decorated. And enough room on the table to actually eat.

Second, and definitely the most important other than the food, is the service. When a restaurant is popular, the staff can get a bit snooty. When a restaurant has enjoyed the massive popularity for the time Carbone has enjoyed it, I expected nothing less than inattentive waitstaff at best and maybe even rude at worst. Again, Carbone proved me wrong.

From the host stand to the waiters to the manager coming by to check on us and engage us in conversation the entire time, it *literally* (as in, the accurate use of that word) made us feel like family. To say everyone was friendly and helpful would be an understatement. The people at the table adjoining us were enjoying their meal and the lady, in her excitement was taking pictures of the surroundings. The staff jumped right in and helped her take pictures and took pictures of her and her husband. The entire house had an amazing vibe as a result of the staff and we left there feeling like we had made friends.

Third, the food. Look, like I said before I wanted it to be "meh." Why? Because this place is hard to book and I wanted to not want to eat there again. But dang it, the food was incredible. So much so that we "over ordered" for the two of us and still ate every single morsel until we were completely fat, dumb, and happy.

I'm not a foodie so I can't tell you every last detail of every course we had...you can read all about that in hundreds of other reviews.

But what I will say is that Carbone is one of those places you believe (and in my case, hope) is just another popular spot that doesn't live up to the frenzy...and then it easily does and the memory of that meal and experience stays with you forever.

Thank you to the staff and management of Carbone for making my birthday meal very special. And darn you because now every time I'm in the city I'm going to have to play the reservation game to get a table because I will be back again and again.

Fancy place with good and real Italian flavours. Apparently it is hard to book a table here and I understand why. Hope they can keep this quality as I heard they are expanding across the country. You canâ€™t miss the eggplant and the pasta vongole
A very special place . Very hard to get in, but the ambience, atmosphere, energy, service and food are exceptional. Highly recommend for a special night out
Nothing is better than the spicy rigatoni. It is truly worth the hype. Great service and warm fun atmosphere makes you feel like you're back in time in the "rat pack"days.
Just exactly as expected. Great execution of what they do. Great feel to the restaurant.
The spicy vodka rigatoni was good. The pork chop was decent. Service is very attentive. The spot has an old school luxury vibe to it.

When you have been an institution like this restaurant has for decades, you continue to serve food at the level they do, oh yeah, and have Spike Lee, sitting at the table next to yoursâ€¦ You would think the staff would have stopped trying a long time agoâ€¦ but for our first time here, we were blown away. From the time we stepped in, to the end of our meal, the staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. As we walked to the back, everyone greeted us with a smile, checked on us constantly, and the dropping and clearing of our entrÃ©es was timed like a ballet. With tables close, we had a great chat with some locals, but we have to say, our server, Mark stole the show. Engaging, informative, willing to mix and match foods (you canâ€™t go wrong with splitting the Branzino and rigatoni)  not to mention his great sense of humor (even giving a nod to my oblique Fargo reference!), he was a highlight of our trip and finding gems like this keeps us coming back to NYC every year at this time!
Carbone is an amazing restaurant IF youâ€™re able to get a reservation which can be impossible. The food is amazing! The Caesar salad and rigatoni are a must. Everything they brought out was great
The restaurant is way overrated. Theyâ€™ve re-created a Italian red sauce joint which I give them credit for but the food is nothing to write home about
Carboneâ€™s is fabulous!  Loved it!  Hard to get a Rez. Have to book one month out to the day!  Worth it!

Our meal at Carbone was almost 3 hours long and full of delicious food from beginning to end. Recommend going in a group and eating family style.

The two above average drinks were definitely the Negroni and the espresso martini. I wouldnâ€™t recommend the other cocktails in comparison.

The table starters were a delicious, crispy garlic bread, a soft tomato bread, cauliflower in an acidic drizzle, and pieces of wheat sesame bread. The garlic and tomato breads were exactly how you want them.

Tableside Caesar salad has plenty of parm and a wonderful dressing with a spicy kick/twist to it. Somewhat unique and subtle spin on a classic dish. Just like the Carbone menus, the croutons were also comically large.

Words canâ€™t describe the spicy rigatoni, which everyone and their grandmother has heard about. Creamy, small kick of spicy, and symphony of flavors all dancing in your mouth, textured onto al dente pasta. Best dish of the meal.

The spaghetti pomodoro was similar to the Caesar salad in that it has a subtle Carbone-twist while maintaining the core of the dish. Strong basil flavor and very well made sauce.

The fettuccine al funghi has a light mushroom flavor with a soft oil glaze. The flavors were not saturated and overall paled in comparison to its spicy vodka sibling. Wouldnâ€™t recommend this one.

Broccoli rabe is probably an acquired taste, but we thought it was wayyy too bitter to finish. Skip.

The desserts were all solid but unfortunately nothing to write home about. The rainbow cookies were very chocolatey and dense, tiramisu was moist and light-medium, carrot cake was thick (best dessert if I had to choose), and the pistachio gelato was very very (read: too) rich.

Service was top notch, and felt more genuine/â€œstraight upâ€ than most Michelin restaurants. Waiter was a no-bullshit type guy and accommodating to our partiesâ€™ dietary restrictions. 5/5.

This meal did not disappoint. Start to finish - service was impeccable but friendly. Our waiter was a little rehearsed but well meaning, and the rest of the staff were top notch.

The meal! The grandma bread to start was a highlight - all the complimentary starters are good. We had mixed drinks - try the cafe reposado - the rest was average. We couldâ€™ve skipped the calamari - it was good but thereâ€™s a limit to how special fried squid can be, and itâ€™s not worth taking up room in your stomach. The mixed salad was good - a little overdressed for me, but a nice way to mix in some fresh veggies. Spicy rigatoni - perfect. We got 1 meatball - the waiter, to his credit, urged us to get just one to try so that we didnâ€™t over order. I really appreciated that. Veal parm was SO good. It had mixed reviews, but I think itâ€™s a highlight - be sure to try the meat on the bone - the table next to us simply discarded it! For dessert we had the carrot cake after we were told the hazelnut cake was retired. It was good, and actually better the next day since we ended up taking most of it home. When you leave, take a baci chocolate candy at the door. All in all Iâ€™ll be back!

Visitor from Tennessee. Got a hard to get reservation
This is my honest review. First the service is excellent,
Food starter bread and salami very good
Rigatoni with spicy vodka sauce, one of the best pastas I have tried
Veal Parmesan,  very delicious, large portion , good for sharing
55 wedding anniversary, complementary cheesecake , cookies ğŸ˜ I
Finally , the bill is a pleasant surprise ,when you remember you prepaid Part of it
Also
I have mobility issue, I thank the staff for being very accommodating
this place is mid tbh. Some dimes tho, but not enough to offset the weak pasta sauce and bad salads. Torrisi mogs this place to agartha and back.

Great service, good food, Malbec was superb

Portions are huge so ideally best getting a main to share and imo they are priced accordingly as sharing dishes

Came from out of town and this was definitely worth the hype for us.  We probably ordered too much food, but everything we ordered was delicious.  Some of the best Italian food I've had to be honest.  All the staff were also super friendly.  Food came out in a timely manner but we never felt rushed.  Overall great experience!
Great food great service one of the best spicy rigatoni Iâ€™ve had
The food was tasty and the staff was polite. Would love if portion sizes were a bit bigger.

@lydieats ğŸ’• There are too many new openings in the city that you often forget about classic ones. BUT never Carbone. Still one of the hardest tables to book and for good reason.

My fav part is the complimentary garlic bread with salami and mozerella. Hits every time. Esp that cheese ğŸ™‚â€â†•ï¸ğŸ‘ Start with the carpaccio or the salad, both pretty salty so def better with a drink. I rly like the carpaccio, itâ€™s super thin, like spoon-scrapping, so it teases your appetite without filling it.

For pasta, no words needed for the spicy vodka rigatoni ğŸ™†â€â™€ï¸ This dish is what American Italian is built on. Tortellini is solid. Get it if thatâ€™s your thing. I think the meatballs are another must and I donâ€™t even like minced meat. Theyâ€™re good and make the rigatoni taste even better? If youâ€™re strong enough for desserts, get the hazelnut cake but you didnâ€™t do it right if you still have space for that.

ğŸ’• yellowtail crudo MP
ğŸ’• spicy vodka rigatoni $34*

ğŸ’• marioâ€™s meatballs $27*

ë¹„ì‹¸ì§€ë§Œ ë¨¹ì–´ë³¼ë§Œí•œ ë³´ë“œì¹´íŒŒìŠ¤íƒ€ğŸ‘â€¦

Our group of six had an absolutely magical evening at Carbone. We went with what Iâ€™d call the â€œtrifectaâ€ â€“ the rigatoni, tortellini, and ravioli â€“ and each dish was outstanding, perfectly balanced, and full of flavor. For dessert, the tiramisu was decadent, and the chefâ€™s courtesy lemon cheesecake was the perfect refreshing finish to the meal.

The atmosphere was lively yet elegant, and the staff could not have been more attentive and welcoming. They made the entire experience feel special from start to finish.

Carbone delivered on every level â€“ food, service, and ambiance. We left already planning our next visit. Would 100% recommend to anyone looking for a truly memorable dining experience.

Expectations were unreasonably high, figured it had to be all hype - feel like I've had some really excellent authentic Italian.

Was wrong. Everything was
incredible, experience to food. Spicy rigatoni - really good. Pork chop - amazing. The corn with truffles - insane. Fish looked great too.

They even give some super fresh mozzarella at the start with some garlic bread.

Tried the cheesecake and that was fine.

Service was impeccable and they do seem to enforce their dress code. So keep on top of that.

Was thrilled when my boy Dan was able to get reservations - hope you can enjoy the legendary spot too.

Until another visit - back to the supermarket jars ğŸ˜‚

Carbone is an excellent restaurant serving delicious Italian cuisine.  Not an easy place to get a reservation but worth the effort!  I had heard that a lot of celebrities frequent Carbone. The stars that I saw there were the employees. From the guy who grated the cheese onto our pasta to the General Manager, everyone there were so welcoming they made us feel like family. A jewel of a place on the edge of SOHO. Loved it!

We got lucky and got another reservation for a Sunday lunch. Carbone is such a welcoming place. Everyone there treats you like family.  They really care about your experience.  We had a small problem with one dish and that was handled promptly and professionally.  Nobody is perfect but Carbone comes as close as you can get!

I love Carbone, I have been twice and the food is exquisite. From the service, the appetizers, the cocktails, the main course. I think is fantastic. The meatballs are really good, the spicy rigatoni also really good. The Caesar salad is also really good. Not a fan of the lasagna but that may be because I personally donâ€™t love lasagna. Octopus really good as well. The pictures are a combination from both times I went.

Everything exceeded my expectationsâ€”the food, the service, and the atmosphere were all outstanding. The space is small, which makes it feel cozy and intimate. Iâ€™d heard mixed things, with some saying it was just hype, but I was completely blown away.

They start you off with a few appetizers, each one delicious. I ordered the spicy rigatoni vodka, and it absolutely lived up to its reputation. For my main, I went with the pork chop and peppers, since the hostess mentioned the ribs werenâ€™t as strong. That pork chop was phenomenalâ€”by far the best Iâ€™ve ever had. Perfectly tender, packed with flavor, and cooked beautifully.

The playlist added the perfect vibe to the room. I didnâ€™t order dessert, but they surprised me with a small almond pastry at the end, and it was the perfect sweet finish.

Great food but not worth the hassle of how hard it is to get into this restaurant. You must get the spicy vodka rigatoni, meatballs, tortellini, and the table side salad. The truffle corn was really good if you like truffle.

Carbone makes of the best pasta dishes I ever had. I tried fettuccine con funghi and the portion was not too large and there's a decent amount of veggies. Ambience is loud and lively but the space is quite tight. They also offer delicious bread and sides as starters.

A staple of Italian cuisine in Manhattan. Reservations are typically hard to get but are absolutely worth it. The spicy rigatoni vodka and tortellini al ragu are legendary. Make sure to try the cheesecake. Weâ€™ve been numerous times over the years and we will be back!

Great dining experience. It is a small space, so it can get cramped and loud, but staff was accommodating which was highly appreciated. The food itself is solid - we especially loved the spicy rigatoni and the eggplant and zucchini app. The spicy rigatoni is simply very well balanced and I liked the onions. The eggplant dish had a good kick to it and was very flavorful. Only the meatball was not quite up to my friendâ€™s grandmaâ€™s recipe, but thatâ€™s tough competition. The complimentary breads and cheese were excellent and really made the dinner feel complete. Extra shoutout to the sommeliÃ¨re for teaching us about the history of champagne and being fun to talk to! Also, our waiter was very informative and attentive. Having worked in restaurants myself I feel that this is a place that cherishes itself and its staff. A NYC gem.

Overall, we enjoyed our dinner here from start to finish. The highlight dish for me was the tortellini ragu; it was so flavorful , al dente, and creamy. Also major shoutout to the accompaniments swerved at the start. The bread was so delicious that I ended up eating way too much, and I think this had to be the first time I was served complimentary salami (which was delicious).

Went for a birthday dinner. The atmosphere was relaxing and inviting. Although, if you want a brighter dining space, you should request it. The food was absolutely amazing to share and the service was entertaining, the server made sure the birthday girl had the best night. In the end, They brought desserts with candles to light up the room for the birthday and sang and it was wonderful and lively. Definitely will come again for the delicious food and stay for the good spirits.
This place is a total vibe. Service was impeccable. Spicy Vodka Rigatoni was so good. We loved the lobster ravioli. The veal parm was good, but didn't blow us away.

Carpone by Izzy is a small hidden gem for anyone craving authentic Italian food. The dishes are full of flavor and beautifully presented â€” you can really taste the quality. The service is warm and attentive, making the experience even better. Itâ€™s a cozy place, so reservations are a must. Highly recommended for a relaxed, high-quality Italian meal.

Had a great time at Carbone â€” the vibes were immaculate and the food was solid, though slightly below the high expectations set by all the hype. Our server was good and attentive, but the experience did feel a bit rushed, which felt off given the ~$500â€“600 spend for a table of four. That said, the overall ambience and classic dishes still make it a â€œmust-visit-onceâ€ kind of spot, especially if youâ€™re into the New York dining scene.

It was not bad, the spicy rigatoni pasta was good and the ragu was very good though. The mozzarella was very nice and i would go again just for it. In general the spicy rigatoni was better than other higher end locations I will give them that. the servers were not the kindest though.

Great food all around as with any Carbone.  Excellent som and wine selection, had a 1968 red that was truly to die for (not sure it was worth the $3k...but you only live once).   My biggest issue was we had a party of 10 and last minute someone popped in which put us at 11 and they were beyond inflexible (known for this...).  I appreciate they have rules but when you have a relatively small party spending $8-10k for 3 hours (they are pretty strict about turning the tables 2x per evening), it seems reasonable you make the rare exception.

Absolutely everything we ate here was special! I would recommend sharing as everything is delicious. Fun play on mid-century Italian-American vibesâ€¦updated and cool. Itâ€™s a small restaurant so if youâ€™re the unfortunate soul who gets the one table next to the restroom that may put a damper on a romantic evening. Otherwise you cannot go wrong here!!!!!

Came here for lunch  a few weeks ago. Personally I think this place is overhyped by social media. Food was good but the price was too high for that quality. We ordered too much because the staff was a bit pushy and reckoned we should order one more pasta. If we knew the potatoes Louie was in such a bit portion, we would have order the ravioli.
The highlight was the deconstructed carrot cake. I think it was the best dish out of those we ordered.

Been here on about 3 separate occasions and found it to always be cozy, fun and welcoming. Itâ€™s comfort food, hearty with good wine. The salami, burrata and bread they bring out is so good. Love the meatballs and the spicy rigatoni. Around the holidays is particularly nice here

We were lucky because my friends and I had wanted to go, but itâ€™s not easy to get a reservation. We decided to try, and we managed to get one at 5 PM, which was perfect. The food is exquisite, the flavors of each dish are perfect, nothing is overwhelming, and the recommendation from the â€œcaptainâ€ to share was more than perfect. From the starters like the Caesar salad, prosciutto, and Calamari Marco, to the main courses like the Spicy Rigatoni Vodka and the Pork Chop & Peppers, everything was incredible. The wait for the reservation is definitely worth it.

The entire staff serves with great charisma and a positive attitude. We loved Carbone and hope to return. Thank you so much for the wonderful service!

Overrated with mediocre food. We like the other pasta better than their famous rigatoni

If you can get a reso, itâ€™s the kind of place that Iâ€™ll go one time just out of the curiosity and will never return. So many good quality Italian options out there

I was curious of the hype and finally got to go last night. The food was in fact amazing, we had the spicy rigatoni, meatballs, Cesar salad, ribeye, carrot cake and tiramisu. The carrot cake was the only item I felt could have been better. The service was great, Joey was very attentive and friendly. The atmosphere was cozy, definitely a good spot for a date as the music is not overwhelming.

An unforgettable dining experience!

Carbone absolutely lives up to the hype. From the moment you walk in, youâ€™re transported to a glamorous, old-school New York Italian restaurantâ€”but with a modern, elevated twist. The service is exceptionalâ€”attentive without being overbearingâ€”and every dish is prepared with precision and passion.

The spicy rigatoni vodka is hands-down one of the best pasta dishes Iâ€™ve ever hadâ€”perfectly al dente and packed with flavor. The veal parmesan is a showstopper, both in size and taste. And donâ€™t skip the Caesar saladâ€”itâ€™s prepared tableside and feels like a performance in itself.

Itâ€™s definitely a special-occasion spot, but worth every penny for the experience. Canâ€™t wait to return!

No one is more passionate about the food at Carbone than our incredible waiter, Roberto. His knowledge of the menu and drinks elevated the entire experienceâ€”he made every recommendation feel personal and spot-on. Carbone isnâ€™t just a restaurant, itâ€™s a full-on experience with delicious food, expertly crafted cocktails, and top-tier service. The entire staff was attentive and genuinely welcoming. I highly recommend trying the Caesar salad and the lobster ravioliâ€”both were outstanding. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back and absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience!

So I really enjoyed the caesar salad, calamari, rigatoni vodka, garlic bread, and potatoes. The free salami and parm was nice and I liked the service. The food did come out quite slowly especially towards the end. I think the tortellini and salmon can be skipped, nothing special. I donâ€™t hear many people discuss the potatoes so please try it! Youâ€™ve never had potatoes like this before. I want to try some of the other pastas when I go back. The menus are comically large and the tables are unfortunately small. The music is a bit too loud in my opinion to really have conversation with your table. Iâ€™m fine with oldies (I think 50-60s) but just bring down the volume. Itâ€™s a nice vibe in there though. Rainbow cookies sucked to me
What an amazing dinner from start to finish. Phenomenal service. The sommelier was incredibly kind and knowledgeable. Would dine here again in a heart beat.

I dined in here on Friday, April 18th just before my birthday. I have been wanting to dine in at this famous establishment for years. As many know, they only do reservations through Resy unless you're VERY lucky to get a walk in. Be prepared to wait for a long time to get in this place. Though it WILL be worth it. The restaurant is very small yet you do not feel squished. I would say no more than 15 tables between the few small exquisite rooms. I will start with the restaurant. It is beautiful inside and out. The perfect New York experience (if you are not from there). Otherwise as New Yorkers you know what I mean. There are quite a few Italian restaurants across the boroughs but I did enjoy this one. I would say do your research first before dining in so you know what to order to make your experience full rounded. The staff is very professional and you WILL receive top tier industry service. My server was Marcos and he was very kind and efficient. On to the food. I ordered the table side caesar salad and I do not say this lightly that it was one of the best caesar salads I've ever had. They make the dressing and salad all from scratch table side and the taste backs that up. The dressing had such a deep, delicious flavor and do not even get me started on the massive croutons. All excellent. For my starters I also ordered the oysters which was also very good. For my main course I ordered the spicy rigatoni and veal parm which are both staples. The pasta oh my gosh was it good. Be prepared it does have a kick to it but it wasn't overwhelming. By the time I got to dessert I didn't have room but I would be open to trying it for the next visit when I very much look forward to my return.

I wanted to write a separate dedicated message to compliment your manager Brandon. He is splendid and truly a great person. Very professional and displayed great communication to make my birthday lunch enjoyable and memorable.

Thank you Carbone!

Ok. It's OK.

To be fair, I went SPECIFICALLY  and Purposely to try that spicy rigatoni. So that's what we got. We didn't try other items on the menu(aside from the cucumber lemonade). I wanted the sauce to have been thicker and it was good but seemed like it was missing  something

I also get it man. A famous restaurant. A tried and true recipe. Keeping it simple.

Howwwweeevverr, I feel like sometimes the greatest barometer  of a how great a resturant is can be measured through either  their most popular or simplest dish.

NOW THAT MOZZARELLA WITH THE SALAMI AND BREAD STARTER WAS DELICIOUS. Maybe I was just hungry lol

Also the cucumber  lemonade was refreshing, not overly sweet, slight saltiness that really complimented  the appetizer

Maybe on another day, it could be better but I don't know if the reservation  wait time is worth it.

Anyway...

EAT swell friends
